Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: வெருவந்த செய்தொழுகும் வெங்கோல னாயின் ஒருவந்தம் ஒல்லைக் கெடும்.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: The cruel-sceptred king, who acts so as to put his subjects in fear, will certainly and quickly come to ruin.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A tyrannical king ('வெங்கோலன்') is shown ruling through terror. His presence causes his subjects to tremble in fear ('வெருவந்த செய்து').
Layered_Composition.Midground: The very ground beneath his throne, which is built on the fear of his people, is shown to be unstable and is rapidly cracking and crumbling away.
Layered_Composition.Background: The king, along with his throne, is seen plunging into a dark abyss that opens up beneath him. His ruin is depicted as being both certain ('ஒருவந்தம்') and swift ('ஒல்லைக் கெடும்').

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: A tyrant who rules by terrorizing his people will inevitably and quickly face complete ruin.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The foundation of the throne cracking and crumbling is a metaphor for a rule based on fear being unsustainable. The swift plunge into the abyss represents his quick and certain destruction.
Art_Direction.Mood_and_Emotion: Terrifying, unstable, inevitable collapse, swift justice.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: A dark, oppressive, and fearful atmosphere. The king is lit by a harsh, sinister light. The cracks in the ground glow with a hellish red light from the abyss below.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A low-angle shot that looks up at the tyrant, but then tilts down dramatically as the ground gives way beneath him.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, cinematic, with impressive destruction and particle effects.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: Dramatic, high-contrast lighting to create a mood of terror and doom.

Cultural_Anchors: Certain and Swift Ruin ('ஒருவந்தம் ஒல்லைக் கெடும்')
